markings: Watermark: Shield of Nuremburg (close to Meder 204 ca. 1566)
provenance: from collection of Von Lonna, Liphart, Alberdoff, Schloessor, Oppermann and "D"
text: This double woodcut is among the earliest surviving wallpaper examples in existence. Sebald Beham found the model for his satyr in a print by his stylistic mentor, Albrecht Dürer. Although this effusive grapevine design was also issued with a black background, these sheets were printed with only the outline, to allow for hand-coloring.
title: Nymphs and Satyrs Entwined in a Vine
